I felt compelled to write a review for this place following tonight's meal because the experience was just that memorable enough for me.  We were a party of 6 adults with 3 children all 5 years and under, yet we were seated promptly. You would expect it to be packed on a Saturday night, but for some reason--maybe the Olive Garden downstairs took more of their customers this evening, who knows--we got lucky. I like that this location sits on the second floor because they have panoramic windows that wrap around the building so you have the view of downtown Glendale. It makes for a very picturesque background instead of just plain old walls. Really nice, especially if you're out on a date. ;)  We didn't wait too long for our server, who's name was Del. And what I've noticed about most members' experiences, it really all depends on who your server is for that night. Let me tell you, ours was awesome! I have absolutely nothing bad to say about him. If I could rate this based on service and quality of food alone, I would have given it five stars, BUT, I can't be too generous just yet. First things first, Del got our drink orders and let us know that if we wanted to add appetizers he'd be happy to wait for us to make our decisions. And with a group, it's almost guaranteed that this process takes a while. He was really patient and very friendly, always quick with the 'You got it!' or 'Don't worry, I got you' that really sets the tone of the whole restaurant, one that is upbeat and positive.  My two children ordered a small cheese pizza off of the children's menu, which they shared. And two slices is just right for little ones who don't eat very much so that was good. Some of my friends ended up with a variety of pizzas, pasta dishes, and salads. Del brought out this habanero salsa to add to the salads that significantly amped the flavor. We loved it! It definitely made a difference! I ordered the chicken tequila lime fettucine. It was a toss-up between that and the asparagus and spinach spaghettini, which I told him I was planning to get. He suggested the first, so I got that. Our drinks came right away, I love the different types of teas you can choose from. Mine was a mango iced-tea, really delicious and refreshing! And they have free refills! One of my friends ordered tea and later when she asked for more hot water, he gave her an extra bag! How nice is that?! Before our food arrived, we got bread and butter on the house while we waited for our order.  Strike 1: Okay, now this is partly the reason for the missing star. I mean, what happened to their bread?  It tasted like old bread crumbs. Not even dipping it in the vinegar and olive oil or slapping butter on it helped. Not the kind of quality bread I've been accustomed to when I've eaten at CPK in the past. Good thing our food came out right away. My chicken tequila lime fettucine was ALL THAT. I don't think they could have improved it in any way...okay, after I added another wedge of lemon zest to it did it taste complete, but it was perfect! I ate EVERY. BITE. I seriously didn't leave anything on the plate. :) I was really glad I went with that order.   Strike 2: If I had gone with order option #2 and wanted to add chicken, it would have been $4.00 extra, or sauteed mushrooms, would have been $1.00  REALLY? A dollar extra for some shrooms?? Get outta here! So what might have been an $11.00 meal could have easily turned into $16.00. Geez. They're lucky they had fantastic service, not to mention our group is the 'hearty' type with lots of conversations, laughter and a young toddler just beginning to learn table manners, leaving a garden of uneaten food underneath the table. We left that place a mess! Thanks for your patience CPK! Our bill came out to a total of $130ish..not bad for all the stuff we ate and drank!   Keep up the good work and give that server, Del a raise, he's got awesome serving and people skills!

There were a number of wait staff idling, and there really was no reason for me to be standing at the entry door for so long.  If food is not exceptional, then service is a main differentiator when there are so many other restaurant choices.  Mother Dough, for example, has much better pizza. Service was fine once I was seated and the hostess did apologize.  I like all the natural light in the space.

Hey, CPK! Ever heard of the saying, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it?"  Well, this applies to your new menu.  There are some improvements, such as the warm french bread with olive oil prior to your meal.  Anything would be an upgrade from that dreadful sourdough bread with butter squares.  I can appreciate new offerings, but why oh why do you take good food and mess with it? I'm referring to your "new" hand tossed pizza dough and the white pizza. In the past, I used to get the honey wheat crust which was soft and delicious. Now the new wheat dough is flat, dry and tough. And the huge clusters of garlic? No.Thank.You.  The worst offense however, was taking away the delicious globs of that soft white cheese (ricotta?). That was what made this pizza stellar. Now, it's just a thin, dry, barely cheesed "pizza." And it's not good. Our waiter said he's been getting complaints about some of the tweaks to other CPK classic dishes, so I know it's not just me. The only redeeming factor of my meal was the delicious (seasonal) salted caramel pudding.  Give me back my white pizza the way it used to be and I will return you to 4 star status.

CPK is a chain restaurant that has a variety of Italian food - pizzas, pastas, etc. It's never my first choice as the food is only slightly above average. Anyway, we had a large group of people visiting so we ordered CPK for everyone. My friend and I went to pick up the order ($70+) and when we got home, we realized that one of the main dishes (chicken pasta) was missing. UGH. Also, when we went to pick up the food, the gal told us that she didn't have anymore bread (it's complimentary so whatever). Upon arriving home and realizing the missing pasta, I called CPK. They put the manager on the phone (a young charming guy from Austin) and he changed my experience completely. He took off THREE dishes from our bill (cut our bill in half) and was so nice to us when we came back! UPDATE (June 2015): I came back here today after having a positive experience over the weekend at the Burbank CPK. I was disappointed, yet again. I ordered a chipotle chicken pizza with no chicken (it was recommended to us by the Burbank CPK and was delicious). I placed my order for take out. Upon getting home, I noticed a large piece of chicken on one slice of pizza and then after a careful examination, noticed that there were SMALL pieces of chicken on other slices as well! UGH. So frustrating since I noticed this after arriving home. I had checked the box quickly at CPK but the chicken was not noticeable until I was in bright light. I called the CPK and spoke with Ismael who was the manager on duty. He refunded the charge and sent me a gift card in the mail to come back. I will go back with my husband and eat in person there since our issues always seem to be with take-out.

The service is always top notch, with their delicious pizzas and pastas!  We usually order the bbq chicken pizza, fettuccini Alfredo and spinach artichoke dip! Yum yum and yummmmm!  I also love the coupons they occasionally send to me when it's my birthday or Valentine's Day for a $10 off $40 purchase.  It's a nice treat to be discounted when you've been going to a certain resturant for so long  Will always be back, thanks!

The manager came by to apologize and offered another pizza but we refused, asking for it to be taken off the bill instead. She asked about dessert, which we refused. I went here with my brother and this place is very shady to say the least. They act all professional and nice, but most of the time, they just wanted you to buy a lot of food. At the start, the chef brought some chips and guacamole giving it to us since it was our first time. I just ordered water since I was making my brother company.  During the whole meal I noticed the waitress trying to push different entrees, meals, and desserts. At the same time, my brother was simply trying to enjoy a pepperoni pizza. It was irritating to say the least. At the end of the meal, it seems we were charged $5 for the chips and guacamole. Now this is the what got me most upset. Aside from being harassed, they charged us for an entree that we DID NOT order. So if you come in expecting to buy a certain amount, then think again, cause they will charge you for stuff you never asked. On top of it, my brother got ill from the pizza. So I would not recommend this place at all. They are pushy, they prepare what looks like microwave pizza, and just flat out add to the bill at their own discretion. It's a shame too since I tend to dine with family, but this place is definitely off my list and hope the same for anyone else.

I really like CPK and eat there too often when I'm craving for some light American fare. There are many favorites on the menu but my review here is for the Glendale location. I love their "penthouse" location and view down onto Brand Blvd. There's a delightful, open feel to this establishment. They're pretty hard to come by these days.  Had lunch here last weekend. The two of us shared a full salad (BBQ chicken ranch for almost $15) and a wild mushroom pizza (about $14). The price of the food has really gone up over the years. I still remember the days of $9.95 pizzas here. My usual beverage is the strawberry iced tea. They were nice to accommodate our request for an iced coffee. They don't have it on the menu but they made one for us anyway.  I'm not crazy about their complimentary baguette. It has a raw taste to it. The herbed dipping oil is delicious though.  More than half the salad and two slices of pizza were left over from our lunch. Service was great on a busy Saturday lunch service.

I came to this location with my daughter for lunch on my day off from work and was immediately greeted by a friendly host, I liked how she greeted with a smile, asked how we were doing and acknowledge my little 3 year old. On a side note as we were about to get seated another employee smiled and said have a good lunch, so A* for friendly staff. After being seated we were immediately attended by 2 servers, Jed and his trainee Mike who both displayed great restaurant hospitality. Jed acknowledged my daughter as well and always checked in on us to make sure we were okay.  I mentioned to my servers I was a former employee and Jed and I had mutual co-workers so we had a little conversation about people we knew.  My experience was pleasant, food was excellent, restaurant is clean. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because throughout our dining experience I noticed the host was telling other guests about some sort of CPK promotion, sign up and get a free small plate, which when I overheard wondered why she didn't mention the promotion to me as I would have loved to sign up. Also a group got seated right next to our table and the chef came out personally and brought them a complimentary chips and guacamole. So everyone was getting some sort of special treatment besides my daughter and I.  So I hope all staff improves on consistency if there are promotions and the chefs don't just give out free stuff because it's a table of 4 ladies. Other than that my overall experience was good enough to overlook it.

Frankly, I'm surprised that CPK is still around. It might have been a novel, upcoming establishment back in the 90s, but now it is just far beyond its prime. I admire some of their creativity in making pizzas with less than typical ingredients, but whatever quality that may have existed is just gone. While the Sicilian pizza I had surely wasn't skimpy on ingredients and was a good size for the price, there was barely any sauce or cheese. It was a dry, bland pizza where I felt like I was merely eating bread with meat toppings. I could've stuck to the bread and olive oil if I wanted a carb heavy dinner. It's not just specific to the Glendale location, but a couple other locations had subpar pizza as well, so it seems like the CPK brand has suffered in general. They still have some decent salads and a couple other items, but the pizza is a fraction of what it used to be. CPK, it's time to call it a day. You had a good run, but there are a lot of new players in the game that do it much better.

California Pizza Kitchen is located on Brand Blvd in Glendale. This is a beautiful location as it is right near these gorgeous apartments and a fountain with lush greenery surrounding it. It is walking distance from the Americana on Brand and is on the second level.  My boyfriend and I had dinner here the other night. As you walk into CPK, you are (occasionally) greeted by the host or hostess. When we got our booth, our server came to greet us and asked us right away if we would like anything to drink. We got two iced waters w/ lemon and extra lemons on the side. He forgot our extra lemons. We then ordered Bread w/ Olive Oil. That was very tasty and addicting! Couldn't stop reaching for more!  For our entrees, my boyfriend ordered Chicken Tequila Fettuccini. He orders it every time and loves it! I ordered the Hand Tossed Margarita Pizza. It was okay. Just okay. The dough wasn't crispy enough it just tasted very chewy and difficult to cut through with a fork and knife. The toppings were good though.  Our waiter was nice, not excellent nor terrible. Just average. I'm giving them 4 stars and not 3 because although my pizza wasn't perfect and the waiter was average, my boyfriend and I had a great time with each other and he enjoyed his entree a lot.

First off the bartender I think his name is Joe was garbage. He was too slow to even take our orders. Even when he returned my change he basically tossed it back on the counter to me. In a lot of cultures I think that's considered disrespectful and rude. But the reason why I gave 5 stars was because of the manager with the hair combed back and earrings. He was extremely helpful and polite at all times. He was hard and fast working jumping around everywhere to make sure everything was going perfect. He was working under a lot of pressure and it didn't phase him. As a business owner myself it's extremely hard to find a manager as great as him. Cpk should give him a raise in my opinion. Food was good also.

After sunday mass we decided to hit up CPK in Glendale. This particular location has a grand view of Central Ave. Nothing better than having an excellent view, on a beautiful Sunday afternoon as you enjoy your delicious meal. As soon as we entered, the receptionist at the front greeted us with a gorgeous smile. What a way to enter a restaurant, to be welcomed, and feel like you're welcomed. As soon as we were seated, we were greeted by our server Frank. Frank was excellent! Period. This is a guy that enjoys his work. Very lively, fun, and playful, and of course professional. They will not charge you for trying something you didn't like. So when he gave me the CPK CHALLENGE, I went ahead and ordered the THAI PIZZA, and sure enough I didn't like it. So he gave me my original order.  At no extra charge. Excellent! So when you're there make sure to ask for Frank. And be ready to be wowed by his fantastic personality, that will make you give him a generou$ tip.

While the Sicilian pizza I had surely wasn't skimpy on ingredients and was a good size for the price, there was barely any sauce or cheese. It was a dry, bland pizza where I felt like I was merely eating bread with meat toppings. I could've stuck to the bread and olive oil if I wanted a carb heavy dinner. It's not just specific to the Glendale location, but a couple other locations had subpar pizza as well, so it seems like the CPK brand has suffered in general. They still have some decent salads and a couple other items, but the pizza is a fraction of what it used to be. CPK, it's time to call it a day. You had a good run, but there are a lot of new players in the game that do it much better.

The event had us shaken up for the rest of the night...the food was good but that whole debacle definitely skewed the evening, and I admit, this rating.

The waiters at CPK are what makes this location great, so friendly and professional.  If this was a review just for them, it would be ten stars.  I'm sure I've met all of them here.  So thank you to them for always making it a great experience, and they still do.  The waiter on this particular night was stellar. I think this location as a whole is very confused about what they're actually needing to improve, so much that they got a new manager who was literally going back and forth with me over a $3.74 up charge on the same dish I've been ordering here and tons of other locations since forever.  In principle it was weird to me that he was so adamant about what the final price of the dish should be - a dish that I've been ordering with the same substitution for almost 10 years (no chicken, swap for veggies).  No location has ever been short of amazing at delivering this substitution, which is part of why CPK has had my trust.  This disagreement makes me iffy about how I feel dining here again after being a loyal customer who has spent literally thousands of dollars at CPK.  How could I not be surprised by almost $4 added to the base price?  It really disappoints me and not want to come back anymore or bring all of my family here.   So, I'm not sure how to feel - more surprised than anything.  I think they're focusing on the wrong corners to improve in Glendale.  And it really has nothing to do with the Glendale waiters - they have been the best part of this place and should be valued like gold by the company.

I even told them that I did not want to have to remind them again because it was supposed to be a surprise. Yeah, that did not happen. No cake. No surprise for the birthday girl.

One of my favorite restaurants! Great food and great service! Serj our waiter was awesome and very nice he gave us excellent service and made sure we were satisfied with our meal definitely coming back!

We had a lovely time here. We sat at a booth with a nice view. Our server was great. We asked questions and he answered them honestly. We had a hard time deciding what to eat so we decided to share our dinner, family style. Portion sizes were big enough for us to do that.  Everything we had was amazing! Our server kept checking back and refilling our drinks.
